verb.description: Look or gaze in an unpleasant, malicious, or lascivious way.
examples: bystanders were leering at the nude painting

noun.description: An unpleasant, malicious, or lascivious look.

origin: Mid 16th century (in the general sense look sideways or askance): perhaps from obsolete leer cheek, from Old English hlēor, as though the sense were to glance over one's cheek.
